org.nzdis.micro

Class AbstractAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.constants.States
      • org.nzdis.micro.constants.AgentStates
        • org.nzdis.micro.messaging.AbstractCommunicator
          • org.nzdis.micro.AbstractAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Agent, MessageCommunicator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnonymousAgent, HeartbeatAgent, SystemOwner

    public abstract class AbstractAgent
extends AbstractCommunicator
implements Agent
    The Class AbstractAgent is the core implementation to the agent interface provided with the OPAL micro-agent framework. Its specialization needs to implement facilities for handling of incoming messages. The default agent will use AnonymousAgent as its implementation. Created: 26/06/2010
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $ $Date: 2011/06/24 00:00:00 $
    Author:
    Christopher Frantz

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractAgent

        public AbstractAgent(java.lang.String agentName,
                     boolean useNameAsPrefix,
                     java.lang.String agentScript,
                     Agent owner,
                     boolean noOpalHierarchy,
                     boolean ClojureActivated,
                     boolean MessageTransportActivated,
                     boolean killSubAgentsOnDeath)
        Main Constructor for AbstractAgent providing all configuration options
        Parameters:
        agentName - - agent name
        useNameAsPrefix - - indicator if the passed agent name is only to be used as prefix (and completed by the platform with a unique ID suffix)
        agentScript - - Clojure Script name for agent (or "" if none provided) (expected to be in indivCljScript folder)
        owner - - owner agent (will be SystemOwner if none provided)
        noOpalHierarchy - - indicates the integration into the OPAL hierarchy (usually the case)
        ClojureActivated - - indicates if Clojure is to be activated for this instance
        MessageTransportActivated - - indicates if Asynchronous Message Passing support should be activated (not the case for purely reactive agents)
        killSubAgentsOnDeath - - configures how this agent will treat its subagents upon death (true --> kill them, false --> reassign to next higher agent)

      • AbstractAgent

        public AbstractAgent(java.lang.String agentName,
                     boolean noOPALHierarchy)

        public void blockMessageProcessing()

      • sendGroupcast

        public void sendGroupcast(MicroMessage message,
                          Group group)
        Sends message to all agents in specified local group. If group is not specified, message is sent to all sub-agents of the sending agent.
        Parameters:
        message -
        group -

      • sendCustomcast

        public void sendCustomcast(MicroMessage message,
                           Group group,
                           Role role,
                           int numberOfTargets,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> exclusionList,
                           boolean localcast,
                           boolean global)
        Sends message via customized pattern considering all non-unicast and non-Globalcast functionality. -- NOT YET IMPLEMENTED
        Parameters:
        message - - MicroMessage
        group - - Group to send to
        role - - Roles to address
        numberOfTargets - - number of targets for randomized addressing
        exclusionList - - list of agents to be excluded
        localcast - - indicates if message should be send to all agents on local platform
        global - - indicates if Rolecast, Randomcast and Groupcast functionality should be executed globally

      • execClj

        public java.lang.Object execClj(java.lang.StringBuffer cljCmd)
        Executes Clojure s-expressions. Should be used with care as inefficient. Support lazy initialization of Clojure Alternatively link directly to Clojure vars (using getClojureConnector.registerFunction(functionName)) if possible.
        Parameters:
        clj - s-expression to be executed

      • getMessageFilters

        public Role[] getMessageFilters()
        Returns an array of all running message filters (i.e. sub-agents dedicated to this role). It is returned as role array as MessageFilter instances instantiated as inner classes cannot be cast to MessageFilter.
        Specified by:
        getMessageFilters in interface Agent
        Returns:
